item.title: mitchell add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "There is nothing sweeter in this sad world than the sound of someone you love calling your name." -- Kate DiCamillo

item.title: mitchell add a quote by Elizabeth Borton De Trevino
item.description: "Art should be truth; and truth, unadorned, unsentimentalized, is beauty." -- Elizabeth Borton De Trevino

item.title: mitchell add a quote by Janet Evanovich
item.description: "I had an alarm, I had nerve gas, I had a yogurt. What more could anyone want?" -- Janet Evanovich

item.title: mitchell add a quote by Janet Evanovich
item.description: "I was going to go to church, but I decided to get doughnuts instead." -- Janet Evanovich

item.title: mitchell add a quote by Janet Evanovich
item.description: "No Ranger in sight. That's because he's in the wind. You can't see the wind. Or maybe the wind went home to watch Tuesday night fights." -- Janet Evanovich

item.title: mitchell add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "Patrick actually used to be popular before Sam bought him some good music." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: mitchell add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "Nobody felt sad as long as we could postpone tomorrow with more nostalgia." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: mitchell add a quote by Sue Grafton
item.description: "She was the type who went to bars intent on conversation, while he was the type who went in hopes of being left alone." -- Sue Grafton

item.title: mitchell add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "Sometimes the fluffy bunny of incredulity zooms around the bend so rapidly that the greyhound of language is left, agog, in the starting cage." -- David Mitchell

item.title: mitchell add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "...where there's Hilo, oh, there's blissweed." -- David Mitchell

item.title: mitchell add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "Perpetual encagement endows any mirage of salvation with credibility." -- David Mitchell

item.title: mitchell add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "Sobering to think how one accursed night of baccarat can alter a man's social standing so irreversibly." -- David Mitchell

item.title: mitchell add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "Peace, though beloved of our Lord, is a cardinal virtue only if your neighbors share your conscience." -- David Mitchell

item.title: mitchell add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "It's true, reading too many novels makes you go blind." -- David Mitchell

item.title: mitchell add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "A Scot can turn a perfectly decent name into a head-butt." -- David Mitchell

item.title: mitchell add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "What wouldn't I give now for a never-changing map of the ever-constant ineffable? To possess, as it were, an atlas of clouds." -- David Mitchell

item.title: mitchell add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "I made it to Boxing Day because I was too miserable to hang myself. I lie. I made it to Boxing Day because I was too cowardly to hang myself." -- David Mitchell

item.title: mitchell add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "The uncreated and the dead exist solely in our actual and virtual pasts." -- David Mitchell

item.title: mitchell add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "It's a small world. It keeps recrossing itself." -- David Mitchell

item.title: mitchell add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "Writing is such a damn lonely sickness." -- David Mitchell

item.title: mitchell add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "The healthy can't understand the emptied, the broken." -- David Mitchell

item.title: mitchell add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "...now I'm a spent firework; but at least I've been a firework." -- David Mitchell

item.title: mitchell add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "It was my first clue that atheists are my brothers and sisters of a different faith. Like me, they go as far as the legs of reason will carry them - and then they leap. I'll be honest about it. It is not atheists who get stuck in my craw, but agnostics. Doubt is useful for awhile. We must all pass through the garden of Gethsemane. If Christ played with doubt, so must we. If Christ spent an anguished night in prayer, if He burst out from the Cross, "My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?" then surely we are also permitted doubt. But we must move on. To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation." -- Yann Martel

item.title: mitchell add a quote by Sue Grafton
item.description: "I did an about-face and veered into the sandwich shop. What I ordered is none of your business, but it was really good." -- Sue Grafton

item.title: mitchell add a quote by Cynthia Lord
item.description: "How else can hopes go but up?" -- Cynthia Lord

item.title: mitchell add a quote by Ira Glass
item.description: "Nobody tells this to people who are beginners, I wish someone told me. All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it’s just not that good. It’s trying to be good, it has potential, but it’s not. But your taste, the thing that got you into the game, is still killer. And your taste is why your work disappoints you. A lot of people never get past this phase, they quit. Most people I know who do interesting, creative work went through years of this. We know our work doesn’t have this special thing that we want it to have. We all go through this. And if you are just starting out or you are still in this phase, you gotta know its normal and the most important thing you can do is do a lot of work. Put yourself on a deadline so that every week you will finish one story. It is only by going through a volume of work that you will close that gap, and your work will be as good as your ambitions. And I took longer to figure out how to do this than anyone I’ve ever met. It’s gonna take awhile. It’s normal to take awhile. You’ve just gotta fight your way through." -- Ira Glass
